title: Families of Discrete Breathers on a Nonlinear Kagome Lattice
abstract:
The unique geometry of the two-dimensional tripartite Kagome lattice is
responsible for shaping diverse families of spatially localized and
time-periodic nonlinear modes known as discrete breathers. We state conditions
for the existence of breathers and compute their spatiotemporal profiles near
the edges of the linear phonon spectrum. Our findings include the existence of
strongly nonlinear and dynamically stable breathers inside the band gap,
asymptotic expressions for small-amplitude breather norms, and the construction
of breather families with compact support on the lattice.
